subtitle: Music
Taking a few moments each day or week to have an attitude of gratitude may improve
your life and the life of those around you.
Find a quiet place to sit or lie down comfortably.
Bring your awareness to your breath.
Notice how you're breathing.
Close your eyes if you wish and take a few slow, gentle, deep breaths in and out.
Centering yourself.
Allow the outside world to fade away as you turn your attention inward.
Bring your awareness to your body.
Starting from the top of your head, slowly move down through your body,
noticing any areas of tension or discomfort.
With each breath, imagine releasing any tension,
letting it melt away.
Connect
with a feeling of gratitude,
a sense of gratefulness and thankfulness.
Bring your awareness back to your body and feel appreciation
for this miraculous vessel that houses you.
Reflect
on the incredible ways it allows you to do what you want to do
and how it supports you to experience life.
The ability to move, feel, see
and hear.
Experience gratitude for the health and vitality
that your body provides.
Shift your focus to the present moment.
Feel the gift of now.
Allow yourself to be fully present and grateful
for the simple fact of being alive.
Bring appreciation for your mind and how it helps you
to understand and process information.
Appreciation for your emotions
to feel nuances in the depth and breadth of life.
Notice
the gift of your senses.
Become aware of the beauty of the sights you see,
the sounds you hear,
the scents you smell,
the tastes you savor,
and the textures you feel.
Appreciate the richness of the sensory experiences in your life.
Contemplate the people in your life,
your family, friends, teachers, colleagues
or anyone who has had a positive impact on your life,
including any pets or animals.
Reflect on the love and affection
you share with your animals.
Reflect on the love, support and connection you share with them.
Feel gratitude for the relationships that enrich your life.
You may even wish to silently, within yourself,
give them thanks
or in other ways.
Focus your attention on what you are grateful for
and allow that feeling to expand through your whole being and body.
Experience appreciation
for what you have already created or manifested in your life.
Experience appreciation for what you would like to create
or manifest in your life as though it's happening now.
Recall moments of joy,
achievement and personal growth.
Reflect on the challenges you've overcome
and the life you've lived.
Recall moments of joy, achievement and personal growth.
Reflect on the challenges you've overcome
and the lessons you've learned.
Express gratitude for the journey of life
with all its ups and downs
and the opportunities for growth and resilience.
Expressing gratitude
is a natural form of love.
Experience being grateful for yourself
just as you are now.
Appreciating the love
for who you are now.
Appreciating the beautiful soul of who you are.
It is natural to want to improve your life
and make things better.
Notice what you want to enhance in your life
while also appreciating the good
that is presently happening in your life.
The more you experience gratitude
in your life,
the more you experience gratitude
in your life,
the more you experience gratitude
in your life,
the more you will likely feel more joy, love, peace,
compassion for yourself and others
and the more that your intuition will grow
making better and healthier choices
in your life and moving forward with greater meaning
and purpose.
When you're ready, you can open your eyes
and bring your attention back to the room
carrying the sense of gratitude with you into your day.
Being thankful for
what abundance you do have in life
and choosing to approach each moment
with an open heart and a grateful spirit.
Thank you for being with me. You are the reason
that we are here.
